channel.title: Rhino
channel.description: Scripting languages for Java are stupid. Agreed?

item.title: Rhino
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“skepskep, post:20, topic:332933”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=429354.msg3152727#msg3152727 date=1268700874]

Rhino and other substitute programming languages have a number of uses that Java can’t support alone. Yes, Java is faster as it is, but whilst using Rhino you can manipulate the API that Java supports and weave in other methods using Rhino. There’s a purpose for everything.

Rhino is written in Java.

Obviously java can support any ‘uses’ it may have.
[/quote]If what you’re doing requires implementation of such other languages, then in that case I suppose it would be useful. Rhino was made to implement JavaScript in Java.

JavaScript wasn’t made to be implemented into Java.

http://www.raditha.com/java/javascript.php

Yes, applets. Javascript is a web scripting language after all.

But RSPS are not applets.[/quote]Who said Rhino was to be integrated for RSPS?

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:21, topic:332933”]Pointless and faggity faggity thread. Really, who cares.[/quote]It’s better than the other threads.

Read full topic

item.title: Rhino
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“skepskep, post:6, topic:332933”]And so why should you not add scripting languages? Python, groovy, and many scripting languages are so similar to java anyways. It really doesn’t make it any easier to develop.[/quote]Rhino supports things that Java, alone, doesn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Rhino
item.dc:creator: @skepskep skepskep
item.description:
@skepskep wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:332933”][quote author=skepskep link=topic=429354.msg3152372#msg3152372 date=1268678421]

Um,Why do you think so? and I don’t know why you making a thread about this…

Because straight up Java is faster than parsing scripts?

Really, anyone who is using a scripting language here probably has no good reason.
[/quote]

With that logic, straight up C is faster than Java, so using Java is stupid. Straight up Assembly is faster than C, why is anyone using C? Straight up binary is faster than Assembly, why don’t people just write all their code in binary?

Do you get my point? Execution speed isn’t always the issue, sometimes ease of development and maintenance are more important. For example a server that allowed you to add content written in something like python would be awesome.[/quote]

Assembly and binary aren’t even practical since they aren’t high-level languages.

And the client is written in Java so writing a server in Java is more practical than writing a server in a C based language. Why learn 2 languages? You’re going to have to look at the client to learn the protocol.

And so why should you not add scripting languages? Python, groovy, and many scripting languages are so similar to java anyways. It really doesn’t make it any easier to develop.

The Reaper X:

Rhino and other substitute programming languages have a number of uses that Java can’t support alone. Yes, Java is faster as it is, but whilst using Rhino you can manipulate the API that Java supports and weave in other methods using Rhino. There’s a purpose for everything.

Rhino is written in Java.

Obviously java can support any ‘uses’ it may have.

Read full topic

Um,Why do you think so? and I don’t know why you making a thread about this…
[/quote]

Because straight up Java is faster than parsing scripts?

Really, anyone who is using a scripting language here probably has no good reason.[/quote]A majority of the users here have no idea what you’re talking about.

Rhino and other substitute programming languages have a number of uses that Java can’t support alone. Yes, Java is faster as it is, but whilst using Rhino you can manipulate the API that Java supports and weave in other methods using Rhino. There’s a purpose for everything.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Because straight up Java is faster than parsing scripts?

Really, anyone who is using a scripting language here probably has no good reason.[/quote]

With that logic, straight up C is faster than Java, so using Java is stupid. Straight up Assembly is faster than C, why is anyone using C? Straight up binary is faster than Assembly, why don’t people just write all their code in binary?

Do you get my point? Execution speed isn’t always the issue, sometimes ease of development and maintenance are more important. For example a server that allowed you to add content written in something like python would be awesome.
